alert.note: Alert for Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 05 at 7:31AM CDT until April 05 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northern Jones County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 815 AM CDT. * At 730 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Collins, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Laurel and Ellisville around 750 AM CDT. Tuckers Crossing around 800 AM CDT. Sandersville around 805 AM CDT. Mill Creek around 810 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Soso. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
